title: Reproduce the applied example in A translational framework of genoproteomic studies for cardiovascular drug discovery
text: GWAS summary statistics LDL-C available Global Lipids Genetics Consortium GWAS summary statistics CAD available CARDIoGRAMplusC4D Consortium GWAS summary statistics 78 clinical endpoints LDL-C UK Biobank available Neale lab Summary statistics cis- trans-eQTLs available eQTLGen phase 1

what: 2. Reproduce the results of the applied example
title: Reproduce the applied example in A translational framework of genoproteomic studies for cardiovascular drug discovery
text: applied example replicates three promising LDL-C-lowering therapeutic targets encoded APOB Ference et al. (2019), LDLR Ference et al. (2019), LPA Trinder et al. (2020) loci, developed current clinical trials O’Donoghue et al (2022).
code: datPosCtrl <- data.frame(   `Druggable genes`= c("APOB","LDLR","LPA"),   `chr:pos (GRCh37/hg19)`=c("2:21224301-21266945",                             "6:160952515-161087407",                             "19:11200038-11244492"),   `OR (95% CI)`=c("1.28 (1.22,1.29)",                   "1.45 (1.41,1.50)",                   "1.30 (1.25,1.33)") ) knitr::kable(   datPosCtrl,   captions="Genetically mimicked LDL-C-lowering effects on CAD")

previous_headings: 2. Reproduce the results of the applied example
what: 2.1 The translational framework for cardiovascular drug discovery
title: Reproduce the applied example in A translational framework of genoproteomic studies for cardiovascular drug discovery
text: Briefly, framework consists four main stages, Causal biomarkers screen Drug-targeting protein discovery verification Elucidation possible heterogeneous genetic effects oriented polygenic IVs across genome biomarker, utilizing methodologies Genome-wide mR Analysis Pervasive PLEitropy (GRAPPLE) MR-PATH Exploration putative protein-disease association using cis-acting pQTL IVs, supplemented inclusion trans-acting variants cis-position, trans-acting variants, appropriate Verification putative drug-targeting proteins examining whether cis-acting variants shared causal variants upstream regulators downstream intermediates, utilizing colocalization based gene expression database conducting cell animal experiments. Drug target relevant side effects exploration Therapeutic efficacy safety emulation

previous_headings: 2. Reproduce the results of the applied example
title: Reproduce the applied example in A translational framework of genoproteomic studies for cardiovascular drug discovery
code: ## preparation source(paste0(path.res,"/0_precondition_update.R")) source(paste0(path.res,"/utilities_update.R")) ## codes for stage 1. Causal biomarkers screen source(paste0(path.res,"/1_cause_biomarkers_screen_update.R")) ## codes for stage 2. Drug-targeting protein discovery and verification source(paste0(path.res,"/2_discovery_verification_update.R")) ## codes for stage 3. Drug target relevant side effects exploration source(paste0(path.res,"/3_side_effects_update.R")) ## codes for Stage 4. Therapeutic efficacy and safety emulation source(paste0(path.res,"/4_target_trial_emulation_update.R"))

what: A translational framework for drug target discovery
title: A translational framework for drug target discovery
text: goal drugTargetScreen implement translational framework genoproteomic studies cardiovascular drug discovery. details please refer manuscript.

title: A translational framework for drug target discovery
text: can install developed version drugTargetScreen GitHub:

title: A translational framework for drug target discovery
text: illustrate proposed translational framework can used help prioritize drug targets accelerate drug development process, provided step--step applied example screening verifying low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C)-lowering drug targets statins (HMGCR), ezetimibe (NPC1L1), PCSK9 inhibitors, considered positive control examples validating lipid-related therapeutics targets coronary artery disease, detailed . Note: run applied example successfully, edit scripts data, parameters, physical paths.
